faq_dataset.question: What are the courses in semester 1?
faq_dataset.answer: Semester I includes: 23BS1101 - Linear Algebra & Calculus (3 credits), 23BS1102 - Engineering Physics (3 credits), 23ES1104 - Introduction to Programming (3 credits), 23HS1105 - Communicative English (2 credits), plus several lab courses including Physics Lab, Programming Lab, Engineering Workshop, and IT Workshop.

faq_dataset.question: What are the courses in semester 2?
faq_dataset.answer: Semester II includes: 23BS2102B - Chemistry (3 credits), 23PC2104A - Data Structures (3 credits), 23ES2105 - Engineering Graphics (3 credits), plus Chemistry Lab and Data Structures Lab.

faq_dataset.question: What are the courses in semester 3?
faq_dataset.answer: Semester III includes: 23HS3102 - Universal Human Values 2 (3 credits), 23CS3651 - Python Programming Lab (1 credit).

faq_dataset.question: What are the courses in semester 4?
faq_dataset.answer: Semester IV includes: 23BS4101B - Discrete Mathematics & Graph Theory (3 credits), 23BS4102B - Probability & Statistics (3 credits), 23CS4303 - Operating Systems (3 credits), 23CS4304 - Database Management Systems (3 credits), 23CS4305 - Software Engineering (3 credits), 23MC4107 - Environmental Science (audit), 23ES4152 - Design Thinking & Innovation (2 credits), plus Operating Systems Lab and Database Management Systems Lab.

faq_dataset.question: What are the prerequisites for Database Management Systems?
faq_dataset.answer: Database Management Systems (23CS4304) has Data Structures (23PC2104A) as a prerequisite.

faq_dataset.question: What topics are covered in Operating Systems?
faq_dataset.answer: Operating Systems covers process management, memory management, file systems, synchronization, deadlocks, CPU scheduling, and system calls.

faq_dataset.question: What is Digital Logic and Computer Organization about?
faq_dataset.answer: Digital Logic and Computer Organization (23ES3103C) covers number systems, Boolean algebra, logic gates, combinational and sequential circuits, computer architecture, instruction sets, and memory organization.

faq_dataset.question: What are the textbooks for Software Engineering?
faq_dataset.answer: Software Engineering (23CS4305) uses: 1. Rajib Mall, Fundamentals of Software Engineering, PHI Publication, 5th Edition. 2. Roger S. Pressman, Software Engineering A Practitioner's Approach, McGraw Hill, 9th Edition.

faq_dataset.question: How many credits is Linear Algebra and Calculus?
faq_dataset.answer: Linear Algebra & Calculus (23BS1101) is a 3-credit course with L-T-P structure of 3-0-0.

faq_dataset.question: What programming languages are taught?
faq_dataset.answer: The program teaches C programming in first semester, Java in Object-Oriented Programming, Python in Python Programming Lab, and web technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP in Web Programming and Full Stack Development courses.

faq_dataset.question: Which courses have the most comprehensive textbook resources?
faq_dataset.answer: Courses with detailed textbook specifications include those with multiple recommended texts. Check individual course overviews for complete textbook lists.

faq_dataset.question: How can I find reference materials for advanced topics?
faq_dataset.answer: Each course provides reference book recommendations. Advanced courses typically have extensive reference lists including research papers and specialized texts.
